title: Large-Scale Program Learning-Based Educational Curriculum for Design Thinking Concept Acquisition

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental problem-solving skills and elementary understanding of design processes
context.additional_context: Parallel implementation of step-by-step digital program learning materials using personal devices (BYOD) and real-world problem-solving projects

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the five stages of design thinking (empathize, define, ideate, prototype, test).
Learners can propose structured solutions to given real-life problems following the design thinking process.

Within six months, learners will complete one mathematics project applying the four-stage design thinking process (problem definition, ideation, prototyping, testing) using GeoGebra or Desmos, and score at least 70 points in peer and instructor evaluations (30% creativity, 30% feasibility, 40% mathematical accuracy)

In teams of 4–5 members, learners will apply the five-stage design thinking process (empathize → define → ideate → prototype → test) to select one community issue, develop a problem-solving prototype, and achieve at least 80 points in peer and instructor evaluations (30% creativity, 30% feasibility, 40% collaboration efficiency)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
